replies.msg:
各位大英帝國做緊嘢／將會做嘢嘅巴絲打，歡迎入嚟呢到鳩噏扮下工

Q&A credit to 滑蛋豬仔飯

Q: 如果無BC又想係英國打工係咪好難?

A:
通常會比working visa一係大公司
D細公司仔都見過有批不過當然會少D

老老實實渣BNO/特區係就係難D不過都唔係無可能
都識得有人搞得掂個visa
以前有同學會係cv度寫明話要working visa
如果間公司都肯in你既話多數即係肯批
唔洗浪費大家時間
大小公司都有 試下無妨

再唔係學其他巴打講
申請左working holiday做住先都未嘗不可
當然之後整唔整到tier 2 working visa就唔敢講
不過起碼都有2年比你係度做下野儲下經驗先

如果做開比較專業行業既朋友其實拎左working holiday visa先，再轉tier 2既機會都幾樂觀，都識幾個朋友都係咁，好似都係做design / I.T.之類 (by 賽麗娜Serena)


Q: 想問下英國見工係咪同香港一樣都係上網報?

A:
如果你話搵工過程其實同香港差唔多
睇你咩工啦
普通黎講大公司既話都係cv cover letter -> online test -> phone in-> assessment centre ( 可以好多round) -> final in
細公司就少幾個步驟咁


Q: 想問下係咪bno 同特區都可以fg 一年tier5 先，唔洗特登要搵肯比tier2 既公司住

A:
你英國畢業定香港想過去？ 唔係英國畢業唔肯定當地申請有無唔同但BNO 隨時可以申請tier 5 重有兩年，特區要抽架，都係兩年。
當地申請可能短d , 我當初因爲公司未令到可以簽visa 既licence 就幫我申請住tier 5 先，得特區又過左抽籤所以係visa 公司幫我係英國申請，但咁就得一年.. 無深究點解。
但全部香港申請過去既都有兩年。 (by 花生哥)

Q: 下年打算去working holiday 會唔會好難搵工同搵地方住（想住反係zoom1,2) 聽人講就話最好係香港搵定先去係好定唔好 我就做開酒吧個邊會唔會香港人 真心求教

A:
英國bar tender既需求量其實好大 因為佢pub既數量基本上同香港7仔有得揮 甚至係正常既餐廳入面都會有間pub仔/bar比人淨飲野吹水
所以你有經驗根本唔洗驚 去到英國任何一個地方都一定搵到野做

講我自己經驗啦 我就做好typical既西餐廳既 入面全部鬼佬
因為要升supervisor 所以gm要求我識哂餐廳所有部份 包括floor hatch同bar
Bar嗰邊我完全係一張白紙 連用咖啡機都唔識 基本上淨係識開水喉倒果汁呢d白痴都識做既野
去到依家講緊一個在既時間 叫做忙起上黎可以打哂三邊 聽日冇人返比人編左去自己睇bar

我覺得做bar最緊要係識同客吹水 尤其係餐廳bar
好似我地咁 係住宅區 長期都有熟客日日黎打"等" 真係日日風雨不改黎報到
黎到冇野做咪同bar tender吹水囉 所以你一定要好吹得

其餘都冇乜野擔心 驚咪去indeed search下囉 一大炸請緊人 (by 小野屋杏)

Q: 英國黎緊暑假畢業，準備搵工 （宜家4月中係咪太遲)

A: 唔遲
雖然有啲係截左
但仲有好多
留學生有優勢 就係唔怕relocation
成個英國既工你都apply得
宜家真係開始send cv都唔會太遲既
好多大公司如果唔係grad scheme既話其實一路都請緊人
以前好多同學都係8/9月先有offer
有D直頭下年1月先有工開
所以唔洗擔心既肯踏出第一步搵工就ok (by 馬壯FN2)

For those of you who wants to become a British Citizen after getting Indefinite Leave to Remain in the UK, you can take advantage of your British National (Overseas) status to register as a British Citizen using form B(OTA).

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/application-to-register-as-a-british-citizen-form-bota

Registration is easier than naturalisation. Form B(OTA) has 16 pages while form AN (for naturalisation) is 30 pages long.

Registration is also a cheaper process than naturalisation. Registration to become a British Citizen using form B(OTA) costs £1163 in 2017 prices while naturalisation using form AN cost £1282 in 2017 prices.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/607005/NationalityFeesLeaflet_2017.pdf

生死有命，富貴由天
想問下National Insurance係咪要留英三年先可以申報 同埋如果申請左National Insurance起英國做左三年野交左三年英國稅 之後返香港撈係咪要交兩邊既稅？

想問下National Insurance係咪要留英三年先可以申報 同埋如果申請左National Insurance起英國做左三年野交左三年英國稅 之後返香港撈係咪要交兩邊既稅？


You will need to pay National Insurance as long as you have a job in the UK. Under the Pay As You Earned (PAYE) system, your employer will take income tax and NI contributions from your wages on behalf of HMRC.

Although I am not an accountant, but as far as I know, the UK, unlike the USA, does not tax British Citizen's incomes from overseas if he/she does not live in the UK. However, you can pay voluntary National Insurance contribution to protect your UK state pension rights if you work overseas.

https://www.gov.uk/voluntary-national-insurance-contributions/who-can-pay-voluntary-contributions

大家好，追左一排ｐｏｓｔ，都見到呢到好多巴絲share 點樣係英國打工，小弟有個問題想請教下大家。

小弟本身無bn，得bno（過左期），好好彩剛剛拎到英國 offer （tier－2），但問題黎啦....可能有d長，請見諒

1. 我本身係香港做緊野，因為係香港搵到新工，做到5月頭resign 左，一個月通知，6月尾就返新工。
2 . 就係我resign 後一星期，英國有個headhunt 打黎問我試唔試下apply 英國果份工，話如果適合，佢地會比埋visa 我。我同左個headhunt講我已經resign 仲簽左另一間香港公司。但佢話佢唔會同呢個公司講住，叫我即管試下睇下得唔得。

3. 點知，佢真係出offer 仲話有tier-2

但問題黎啦，英國果間公司要做Labour market testing 同background check,
整visa（大約要2個月）。因為我apply 英國工果陣已經簽左香港新公司同埋６月尾會開始，最ideal 係我一路做新公司，到佢批晒visa我就係probation period resign 過英國。如果佢check到我resign 左，我咪話想休息下，準備過黎，但headhunt 叫我唔好，話英國果邊會check 到我係香港簽左新公司，想問下大家

1.其實英國果邊會唔會check 到我返緊新工？
2.果邊同香港labour department / TAX 聯絡？正常基於privacy，唔會比資料其他人
3. 其實最容易係我reject 香港新工，等英國visa,　但２個月無糧同埋果邊一個唔該freeze headcount 我就失業

sorry,講到1999
真心希望有巴打或做hr 既朋友可能解答下我

而家我有香港律師牌, 唔知番英國搵律師工難唔難呢? 駛唔駛又另外考埋英國律師牌?

睇資料講而家英國本地d律師都over-supply, 都唔知而家移民過去搵唔搵到食

大家好，追左一排ｐｏｓｔ，都見到呢到好多巴絲share 點樣係英國打工，小弟有個問題想請教下大家。

小弟本身無bn，得bno（過左期），好好彩剛剛拎到英國 offer （tier－2），但問題黎啦....可能有d長，請見諒

1. 我本身係香港做緊野，因為係香港搵到新工，做到5月頭resign 左，一個月通知，6月尾就返新工。
2 . 就係我resign 後一星期，英國有個headhunt 打黎問我試唔試下apply 英國果份工，話如果適合，佢地會比埋visa 我。我同左個headhunt講我已經resign 仲簽左另一間香港公司。但佢話佢唔會同呢個公司講住，叫我即管試下睇下得唔得。

3. 點知，佢真係出offer 仲話有tier-2

但問題黎啦，英國果間公司要做Labour market testing 同background check,
整visa（大約要2個月）。因為我apply 英國工果陣已經簽左香港新公司同埋６月尾會開始，最ideal 係我一路做新公司，到佢批晒visa我就係probation period resign 過英國。如果佢check到我resign 左，我咪話想休息下，準備過黎，但headhunt 叫我唔好，話英國果邊會check 到我係香港簽左新公司，想問下大家

1.其實英國果邊會唔會check 到我返緊新工？
2.果邊同香港labour department / TAX 聯絡？正常基於privacy，唔會比資料其他人
3. 其實最容易係我reject 香港新工，等英國visa,　但２個月無糧同埋果邊一個唔該freeze headcount 我就失業

sorry,講到1999
真心希望有巴打或做hr 既朋友可能解答下我

你提醒左我 雖然稅局唔比資料，但有可能從mpf公司搵到資料，但我如果返左香港新工，好難唔供mpf

我其實可以reject 香港新工，但最怕佢無啦啦freeze headcount，到時我就會低左係到。所以諗住
1. Fake headhunt 話reject香港新工 其實繼續返，但風險係比佢check到 咁就無左呢個難得既機會

2. 同佢講清楚 同埋情況 ，話香港新工一定會辭工再過英國，風險係可能會重新考慮會唔會比offer 我

3. Reject 香港新工，糧地2個月 ，風險係佢freeze headcount 我要再搵工，仲要8-9月無乜工

You should renew your BN(O) passport now using the link below -

https://www.gov.uk/overseas-passports

If you apply now and your case in not complex - i.e. you still have your old BN(O) passport, then the turnaround time is about 2 weeks. There is a post on how to renew your BN(O) passport in the travel section.

You then use your BN(O) passport to apply for your UK tier 2 visa, which means that you will be treated as a Commonwealth citizen in the UK. Using your BN(O) status in the UK have the following advantages -

1) register to vote in all UK elections - also helps you to build up your credit history in the UK.

2) join the British Armed Forces

3) BN(O) holders who live in the UK do not need to register with their local police force while holders of HKSAR passports, as Chinese nationals, are required to register with the local police force.

4) Get British Citizenship via registration using form B(OTA) which is an easier (the form is shorter) and cheaper method than naturalisation (registration £1163 vs naturalisation £1282 in 2017 prices)

You can open an UK bank account in Hong Kong before moving to London. Both HSBC and the Bank of East Asia offer this service.

You can also exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one without test if you received your Hong Kong driving licence via a driving test in Hong Kong.

Correct -

BN(O) passport holders using form B(OTA) to register for British Citizenship is cheaper than naturalisation using form AN. (£1163 for registration vs £1282 for naturalisation in 2017 prices)

係既大佬

One more word of advice for those of you who received your British Citizenship via your parent and born outside of the UK. You are a British Citizen by descent, which means that you will not be able to automatically pass on your British Citizenship to your children born outside of the UK.

There are two ways to get British Citizenship for your children in this case -

1) Having the child in the UK. A child born in the UK with one British Citizen parent is a British Citizen otherwise than by descent. This means that your children can automatically pass down his/her British Citizenship to his/her child (your grandchild) born outside of the UK.

If you are going down this route, I would suggest the birth should take place in Northern Ireland. A child born in Northern Ireland with one British Citizen parent will be an Irish citizen, as well as British Citizen. As Ireland stays in the EU, having Irish citizenship means having EU freedom of movement after Brexit.

2) If you stay in the UK for three years before the birth of the child in Hong Kong, you can apply for a British Citizenship registration with the Home Office before the child turns 18. You will need to submit evidence of your stay in the UK in the application. Please keep such evidence like your P45 and P60, as well as council tax bills. Please note that a child register in this way is still a British Citizen by descent and cannot use the same method to register his/her child (i.e. your grandchild).

Once you are in the UK, you will need to get a National Insurance Number, please see link below for details -

https://www.gov.uk/apply-national-insurance-number

thanks pal. what does it actually mean to have acquired a national insurance number? this doesn't associate with any boring right nor national welfare/benefit right away it's that correct?


You will need to have your National Insurance Number to work in the UK. As an employee, most company will use PAYE to collect income tax and national insurance contribution on the government's behalf. The good news is that whatever the company pays you in wages will be your net wages - you do not need to save up to pay your income tax (as you do in Hong Kong).

Your own benefit and state old age pension entitlement is based on your National Insurance contribution records. Jobseeker's Allowance (JSA) have two elements - contribution based (you will get this element if you paid enough NI contribution in the last two years) and the means tested element (you can only get this if you meet the conditions set by the Department of Works and Pensions).

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/benefits/in-work-or-looking-for-work/benefits-for-people-looking-for-work/#h-jobseeker-s-allowance

British Citizen also need to meet the habitual residence test before getting any social welfare benefits.

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/benefits/coming-from-abroad-and-claiming-benefits-the-habitual-residence-test/the-habitual-residence-test-an-introduction/what-is-the-habitual-residence-test/

You should renew your BN(O) passport now using the link below -

https://www.gov.uk/overseas-passports

If you apply now and your case in not complex - i.e. you still have your old BN(O) passport, then the turnaround time is about 2 weeks. There is a post on how to renew your BN(O) passport in the travel section.

You then use your BN(O) passport to apply for your UK tier 2 visa, which means that you will be treated as a Commonwealth citizen in the UK. Using your BN(O) status in the UK have the following advantages -

1) register to vote in all UK elections - also helps you to build up your credit history in the UK.

2) join the British Armed Forces

3) BN(O) holders who live in the UK do not need to register with their local police force while holders of HKSAR passports, as Chinese nationals, are required to register with the local police force.

4) Get British Citizenship via registration using form B(OTA) which is an easier (the form is shorter) and cheaper method than naturalisation (registration £1163 vs naturalisation £1282 in 2017 prices)

You can open an UK bank account in Hong Kong before moving to London. Both HSBC and the Bank of East Asia offer this service.

You can also exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one without test if you received your Hong Kong driving licence via a driving test in Hong Kong.

Please have a look at this post within lihkg - it appears that BN(O) overseas application now takes about 2 weeks for most cases.

https://lihkg.com/thread/233060

The latest timeline I saw from this post is that -

30 May documents sent from Hong Kong to UK
9 June BN(O) passport sent out to Hong Kong

It is easier to apply overseas than in the UK. In the case of countersigning your photos (not every case requires a counter signature) - if you applied in Hong Kong, any professional with a UK, Irish, Commonwealth and EU passport can countersign, while only UK and Irish nationals can countersign in UK based applications.

If you fill in the online form and paid for it this weekend and then send the documents to the UK on Monday, you can get your new BN(O) passport by the end of June or beginning of July.

[/quote]

You will also need to get a certificate from the Hong Kong Department of Transport to say that your Hong Kong licence is based on the fact that you pass your driving test in Hong Kong. As far as I know that you will need to fill in TD320 in order to get the proof you need.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td320(12.2016)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

You will need to ask the Transport Department how long that certificate is valid for and how much it costs.

As the Hong Kong driving licence does not have a photo of the holder, you may find it helpful to get an International Driving Permit from the Hong Kong Transport Department before coming to the UK.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td51(2017.02)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

咦唔通我相熟係你？你響邊區返工吖？

One more word of advice for those of you who received your British Citizenship via your parent and born outside of the UK. You are a British Citizen by descent, which means that you will not be able to automatically pass on your British Citizenship to your children born outside of the UK.

There are two ways to get British Citizenship for your children in this case -

1) Having the child in the UK. A child born in the UK with one British Citizen parent is a British Citizen otherwise than by descent. This means that your children can automatically pass down his/her British Citizenship to his/her child (your grandchild) born outside of the UK.

If you are going down this route, I would suggest the birth should take place in Northern Ireland. A child born in Northern Ireland with one British Citizen parent will be an Irish citizen, as well as British Citizen. As Ireland stays in the EU, having Irish citizenship means having EU freedom of movement after Brexit.

2) If you stay in the UK for three years before the birth of the child in Hong Kong, you can apply for a British Citizenship registration with the Home Office before the child turns 18. You will need to submit evidence of your stay in the UK in the application. Please keep such evidence like your P45 and P60, as well as council tax bills. Please note that a child register in this way is still a British Citizen by descent and cannot use the same method to register his/her child (i.e. your grandchild).

Based on 2017 prices, Naturalisation fee £1282 / Registration fee £1163 - difference £119

32 page standard Passport fee - Hong Kong applications - £102.86.

Police registration fee - £34

So if you use your BN(O) passport for tier 2 visa and registration to become a British Citizen using form B(OTA) the cost is -

£102.86 - £119 = A saving of £16.14.

On the other hand, using your HKSAR for tier 2 and naturalisation to become a British Citizen, you will need to pay -

£119 + £34 = £153

Overall savings - £169.14.

I know for some bros that £169.14 is nothing, but my thinking is that the money is better in my pocket than in the government's!

You should renew your BN(O) passport now using the link below -

https://www.gov.uk/overseas-passports

If you apply now and your case in not complex - i.e. you still have your old BN(O) passport, then the turnaround time is about 2 weeks. There is a post on how to renew your BN(O) passport in the travel section.

You then use your BN(O) passport to apply for your UK tier 2 visa, which means that you will be treated as a Commonwealth citizen in the UK. Using your BN(O) status in the UK have the following advantages -

1) register to vote in all UK elections - also helps you to build up your credit history in the UK.

Based on 2017 prices, Naturalisation fee £1282 / Registration fee £1163 - difference £119

32 page standard Passport fee - Hong Kong applications - £102.86.

Police registration fee - £34

So if you use your BN(O) passport for tier 2 visa and registration to become a British Citizen using form B(OTA) the cost is -

£102.86 - £119 = A saving of £16.14.

On the other hand, using your HKSAR for tier 2 and naturalisation to become a British Citizen, you will need to pay -

£119 + £34 = £153

Overall savings - £169.14.

I know for some bros that £169.14 is nothing, but my thinking is that the money is better in my pocket than in the government's!

Thanks.


You will also need to get a certificate from the Hong Kong Department of Transport to say that your Hong Kong licence is based on the fact that you pass your driving test in Hong Kong. As far as I know that you will need to fill in TD320 in order to get the proof you need.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td320(12.2016)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

You will need to ask the Transport Department how long that certificate is valid for and how much it costs.

As the Hong Kong driving licence does not have a photo of the holder, you may find it helpful to get an International Driving Permit from the Hong Kong Transport Department before coming to the UK.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td51(2017.02)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

Any problem if using SAR ?


You should renew your BN(O) passport now using the link below -

https://www.gov.uk/overseas-passports

If you apply now and your case in not complex - i.e. you still have your old BN(O) passport, then the turnaround time is about 2 weeks. There is a post on how to renew your BN(O) passport in the travel section.

You then use your BN(O) passport to apply for your UK tier 2 visa, which means that you will be treated as a Commonwealth citizen in the UK. Using your BN(O) status in the UK have the following advantages -

1) register to vote in all UK elections - also helps you to build up your credit history in the UK.

Where you get the £180 from?

A standard 32 page British passport cost £102.86 - including the courier fee.

The other brother said 180£. You need to pay for the passport as well as the application fee



The £102.86 is the Overseas British passport application fee which includes - your new British passport and courier fees to return your new British passport and supporting documents back to you in Hong Kong.

You will need to pay your own postage to send your supporting documents to HMPO in Liverpool. Unless you sent the documents by DHL, I don't think you will need to pay an arm and a leg for this.

2) i have my driving license in HK n I have to exchange it in UK ? Can i do it in Hk?

Oh I found the answer.
https://www.skyscanner.com.hk/news/tips/the-complete-guide-to-convert-hk-driving-license-to-foreign-driving-licenses/

Thanks.


You will also need to get a certificate from the Hong Kong Department of Transport to say that your Hong Kong licence is based on the fact that you pass your driving test in Hong Kong. As far as I know that you will need to fill in TD320 in order to get the proof you need.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td320(12.2016)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

You will need to ask the Transport Department how long that certificate is valid for and how much it costs.

As the Hong Kong driving licence does not have a photo of the holder, you may find it helpful to get an International Driving Permit from the Hong Kong Transport Department before coming to the UK.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td51(2017.02)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

https://www.skyscanner.com.hk/news/tips/the-complete-guide-to-convert-hk-driving-license-to-foreign-driving-licenses/

Thanks.


You will also need to get a certificate from the Hong Kong Department of Transport to say that your Hong Kong licence is based on the fact that you pass your driving test in Hong Kong. As far as I know that you will need to fill in TD320 in order to get the proof you need.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td320(12.2016)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

You will need to ask the Transport Department how long that certificate is valid for and how much it costs.

As the Hong Kong driving licence does not have a photo of the holder, you may find it helpful to get an International Driving Permit from the Hong Kong Transport Department before coming to the UK.

http://www.td.gov.hk/filemanager/common/td51(2017.02)_e-fillable_eng.pdf

One more point for you to consider -

If you were born outside of the UK and received your British Citizenship from one of your parents, then you may be a British Citizen by descent. This means that you cannot automatically pass down your British Citizenship to any of your children born outside of the UK.

You may register any of your overseas born children as British Citizens, under current rules, if you lived in the UK for more than three years before the child was born and apply prior to the child's 18th birthday. Going down this roue will require you to provide evidence of your stay in the UK to the Home Office. I would suggest you to keep any P45 and P60 you got from your work in the UK, as well as council tax (like 差 餉 in Hong Kong) bills and bank statements in your name.

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/application-to-register-child-under-18-as-british-citizen-form-mn1

British Citizenship does not take ten years. My limited understanding is this -

If you came to UK under the Tier 2 (General) visa, you will need to have a salary of £35000 per year in order to apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) in the UK. You can apply for British Citizenship a year after ILR. So you can become a British Citizen after 6 years in the UK.

British Citizenship does not take ten years. My limited understanding is this -

If you came to UK under the Tier 2 (General) visa, you will need to have a salary of £35000 per year in order to apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) in the UK. You can apply for British Citizenship a year after ILR. So you can become a British Citizen after 6 years in the UK.

British Citizenship does not take ten years. My limited understanding is this -

If you came to UK under the Tier 2 (General) visa, you will need to have a salary of £35000 per year in order to apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) in the UK. You can apply for British Citizenship a year after ILR. So you can become a British Citizen after 6 years in the UK.


騎post

So Hkg brother, so if i come with Tier-2 visa n have over £35k per year. If i wanna apply citizenship in UK. What is the procedure once I land UK? (P.s. using HKSAR passport for this visa )

Thanks brother


First of all, you will need to get Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) using form SET(O) after five years residence in the UK. Please see link below for ILR details. After having ILR for a year, you can apply for naturalisation to become a British Citizenship using form AN.

https://www.gov.uk/settle-in-the-uk/y/you-have-a-work-visa/tier-2-general-visa

Do you have British National (Overseas) status? If you have time, you may want to renew your BN(O) passport and use your BN(O) passport to get your Tier 2 visa.

There are three advantages using your BN(O) passport than your HKSAR passport for UK Tier 2 visa.

1) You do not need to register with the local police once you arrived in the UK. This will save you £34.

2) BN(O) passport holders with more than six months leave to enter / remain in the UK can register to vote in all UK elections. Being on the electoral roll helps you to build up your own credit history in the UK.

3) You can register to become a British Citizen rather than naturalise using form B(OTA). Registration is a cheaper process than naturalisation - £1163 for registration vs £1282 for naturalisation - a saving of £119 (2017 prices).

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/application-to-register-as-a-british-citizen-form-bota

As I dun wanna delay the visa until my new BnO arrives, so I will use the hksar one to apply for Tier 2. Is it possible to change my Tier2 from BnO to hksar during the first 5 years?



In terms of changing your Tier 2 from HKSAR passport to BN(O), the honest answer is I don't know as I only used my BN(O) passports for my UK visas. The only way I can see a change in passport is when the HKSAR passport with your Tier 2 visa expires before the Tier 2 visa, then you can transfer your current visa to a new passport. See link below for details -

https://www.gov.uk/transfer-visa

I would strongly suggest you to register to vote in the UK once you have your BN(O) passport. If it is your long term plan to get British Citizenship, then building up your own credit history in the UK via the electoral roll is a good thing to do.

British Citizenship does not take ten years. My limited understanding is this -

If you came to UK under the Tier 2 (General) visa, you will need to have a salary of £35000 per year in order to apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) in the UK. You can apply for British Citizenship a year after ILR. So you can become a British Citizen after 6 years in the UK.


騎post

So Hkg brother, so if i come with Tier-2 visa n have over £35k per year. If i wanna apply citizenship in UK. What is the procedure once I land UK? (P.s. using HKSAR passport for this visa )

Thanks brother


First of all, you will need to get Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) using form SET(O) after five years residence in the UK. Please see link below for ILR details. After having ILR for a year, you can apply for naturalisation to become a British Citizenship using form AN.

https://www.gov.uk/settle-in-the-uk/y/you-have-a-work-visa/tier-2-general-visa

Do you have British National (Overseas) status? If you have time, you may want to renew your BN(O) passport and use your BN(O) passport to get your Tier 2 visa.

There are three advantages using your BN(O) passport than your HKSAR passport for UK Tier 2 visa.

1) You do not need to register with the local police once you arrived in the UK. This will save you £34.

2) BN(O) passport holders with more than six months leave to enter / remain in the UK can register to vote in all UK elections. Being on the electoral roll helps you to build up your own credit history in the UK.

3) You can register to become a British Citizen rather than naturalise using form B(OTA). Registration is a cheaper process than naturalisation - £1163 for registration vs £1282 for naturalisation - a saving of £119 (2017 prices).

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/application-to-register-as-a-british-citizen-form-bota

大家好，剛剛收到英國公司的tier2 offer, 佢問我需唔需要做埋dependent visa, 我有一個同居女朋友，上網睇好似話有同居証明同關係証明(比如相，passport 岀國記錄？），都有機會申請到？機會大唔大？仲有咩資料可以比？有冇人可以幫手解答下

咁好公司主動問你使唔使搞埋dependent visa
好似prove到同居2年就得，有D朋友其實差唔多夠2年都照批
至於要D咩文件真係冇詳細睇，有D朋友有搵律師幫手搞，有D自己搞都搞得掂 我諗上網應該有齊你要provide d咩野既list既

Have you got British National (Overseas) status? If you do, you should apply for your UK Tier 2 visa using your BN(O) passport. By using your BN(O) passport for your Tier 2 visa will offer the following advantages over HKSAR passport -

1) BN(O) holders do not need to register with the local police once you are in the UK, while HKSAR passport holders, as Chinese nationals, are required to register with the police when they arrived.

2) BN(O) passport holders are treated as Commonwealth citizen in the UK, so you can register to vote in all UK elections as a BN(O) passport holder with a Tier 2 visa. HKSAR passport holders are not entitle to vote in any UK elections. Being on the electoral roll helps you to build up your own credit history in the UK.

3) BN(O) passport holders can register to become a British Citizen using for B(OTA), which is a cheaper way than naturalisation. (Registration fee £1163 vs naturalisation fee £1282 - both 2017 prices)

Why they don't want you to go? If you understand the reasons why they are against you coming over to the UK, you may be able to talk them round.

If you are coming to the UK with a Tier 2 visa, there are other points for you to consider -

1) UK bank account - it can be easier for you to open an UK bank account in Hong Kong before moving over here. Both the Bank of East Asia and HSBC offer this service.

2) Driving licence - you can exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one without test if you gained your Hong Kong driving licence by a driving test in Hong Kong. You may also want to apply for an International Driving Permit in Hong Kong before coming over here.

For Tier 2 dependent visa - it can be easier if you two get married.

我有個問題想問
我睇左資料 如果tier 2想拎ilr 就要年薪35k or above 加至少留左係英國5年 少過450日離開英國
同時如果bno想轉bc requirments根據B(OTA) 係至少留左5年 少過450日離開英國

咁如果拎tier 2但年薪唔夠35k既bno holder 係咪5年後都唔可以用B(OTA)去申請bc?


The main problem is that in order to register to become a British Citizen using form B(OTA), you will need to have Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) in the UK for at lease 12 months. If you do not have ILR, your application to register will fail.

You can gain leave to remain in the UK based on long residence in the UK under the following circumstances -

a) 10 years lawful residence in the UK or
b) 20 years of residence in the UK (lawful or not)

If you apply under (a), you will be given Indefinite Leave to Remain in the UK.

If you apply under (b), you will be given an extension of stay with no restrictions on employment in the UK (See immigration rule 276A3)

You can find out more about the 10 year long residence route from the link below -

https://www.gov.uk/long-residence/eligibility

I am talking about the 10 year legal long residence route. Time spent as a student in the UK will count towards the 10 years residence requirement. You can use a mixture of leave in the UK (student / work / spouse) to archive the 10 year legal long residence requirement.

外交部發言人陸慷表示，《中英聯合聲明》作為一個歷史文件，不再具有任何現實意義，希望國際社會認清現實。

陸慷在外交部例行記者會表示，香港是中國的特別行政區，香港事務屬於中國內政。 1984年的《中英聯合聲明》就中方恢復對香港行使主權和過渡期有關安排作了清晰劃分。 「現在香港已經回歸祖國懷抱20年，《中英聯合聲明》作為一個歷史文件，不再具有任何現實意義，對中國中央政府對香港特區的管理也不具備任何約束力。英方對回歸後的香港無主權、無治權，無監督權。希望上述人士認清現實。」

陸慷稱，香港成功不成功，已經為香港回歸祖國20週年的實踐所證明，不是任何外人可以妄加評議的。他列舉數據稱，1997年至2016年，香港本地生產總值年均實質增長3.2%，在發達經濟體重位居前列。近年來香港失業率控制在3.5%以下，低於世界平均水平的5%以上。在美國傳統基金會發布的《經濟自由指數》報告中，香港連續23年獲評全球最自由經濟體。根據瑞士洛桑管理學院發布的《2017年度世界競爭力報告》，香港連續第二年被評為全球最具競爭力的經濟體。

陸慷表示，「香港一國兩制的成功實踐、香港的繁榮穩定、人民安居樂業的局面，可能有些人心裡五味雜陳，但香港特區人民滿意，祖國人民高興。」

Britain said on Friday the joint declaration with China over Hong Kong remained in force, contradicting an earlier statement from the Chinese Foreign Ministry about the blueprint on how the city would be ruled after its return to China in 1997.

"The Sino-British Joint Declaration remains as valid today as it did when it was signed over thirty years ago," a British Foreign Office spokeswoman said.

"It is a legally binding treaty, registered with the UN and continues to be in force. As a co-signatory, the UK government is committed to monitoring its implementation closely."

(Reporting by Michael Holden; editing by Alistair Smout)
